title.narrative: In-Country Counternarcotics Program: Small-scale Construction

description.narrative: Small scale Indonesian Coast Guard (BAKAMLA) Maritime Training Center 3 buildings under U.S. Pacific Command. The U.S. Department of Defense International Counter-Drug Program (ICDP) enables the Secretary of Defense to provide foreign governments with support, such as training and equipment, to combat illicit drug trafficking and transnational organized crime.

title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. title.narrative: Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) - Maritime MOC/JOC Support

description.narrative: The FY2016 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) Section 1263 specifies seven Indo-Pacific Maritime Security Initiative (MSI) nations for assistance and training: Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh. In addition, there is a provision that allows incremental expenses for personnel from Taiwan, Singapore and Brunei to participate in training. Country teams work through the Geographic Combatant Command (GCC) to nominate proposals to Office of the Secretary of Defense and the Joint Staff for approval. DSCA provides program management and execution through the implementing agencies.
